title: Create or update a TikTok account Webhook configuration

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Request message type. Allowed format: application/json .

parameters.name: app_id
parameters.description: ID of your developer application. You can find the App ID by navigating to My Apps > App Detail > Basic Information .

parameters.name: secret
parameters.description: Secret of your developer application. You can find the Secret by navigating to My Apps > App Detail > Basic Information .

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: The type of Webhook event that you want to subscribe to. Enum values: VIDEO : Post publishing events, which provide you with real-time updates on the status of content published via specific TikTok API endpoints. To learn more about the schema and sample payload of the events within this event category, see Post publishing events . COMMENT : comment update event, including the event comment.update . To learn more about the schema and sample payload of the event within this event category, see Comment update event .

parameters.name: item_list
parameters.description: Valid only when event_type is COMMENT . Ignored when event_type is DEFAULT or VIDEO . The IDs of the specific TikTok posts that you want to receive comment update event notifications for. Max size: 100. To obtain the IDs of TikTok posts under a TikTok account, use /business/video/list/ . When event_type is set to COMMENT and item_list is included in the request: If item_list has never been configured for the developer app ( app_id ) previously, you will only receive notifications of comment.update events for the specified posts in item_list . If item_list has been configured for the developer app ( app_id ) before, you will receive notifications for comment.update events of all previously configured posts in addition to the newly specified posts in item_list . When event_type is set to COMMENT and item_list is not included in the request: If item_list has never been configured for the developer app ( app_id ) previously, you will receive notifications of comment.update events for all posts under the TikTok account or TikTok accounts that authorized the developer app ( app_id ). If item_list has been configured for the developer app ( app_id ) before, you will receive notifications of comment.update events for all previously configured posts. To review the specific posts configured for your developer app, check the item_list value in the response.
